Create the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face_1), which is a rectangle. The rectangle is defined by four lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0, 0], End Point [0.5357, 0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.5357, 0], End Point [0.5357, 0.4286] - Line 3: Start Point [0.5357, 0.4286], End Point [0, 0.4286] - Line 4: Start Point [0, 0.4286], End Point [0, 0] The loop is closed, and the rectangle is formed by the four lines. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5357. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.1071 units to create the 3D model. This will result in a rectangular prism with dimensions 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. **Intermediate Part 2: A Cylindrical Object** Create a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to 0 degrees in all axes and the translation vector to [0, 0, 0]. This will position and orient the sketch plane for the second part. Create the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face_1), which is a circle. The circle is defined by its center point at [0.2143, 0.2143] and a radius of 0.2143 units. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.4286. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.3214 units to create the 3D model. This will result in a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The final shape of the assembly is a cylindrical object with a rectangular protrusion on one side. The rectangular prism has dimensions 2 units by 3 units by 4 units, and the cylindrical object has a diameter of approximately 0.43 units and a height of approximately 0.32 units.</description>
